description: Latin lustratus, past participle of lustrare (“to lustrate”), from lustrum. See lustrum.

verbs.description: lustrate (third-person singular simple present lustrates, present participle lustrating, simple past and past participle lustrated)

entries.meaning: To make clear or pure by means of a propitiatory offering; to purify.
examples: We must purge, and cleanse, and lustrate the whole city.
